physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: This file has two different foliation sequences. There is a sequence of large numbers in pencil on each page running through from 52 to 131. The second is a small number in pencil in the top right hand corner of each folio, this is the foliation sequence used in this catalogue to reference items within the file.

mods.abstract: This volume mainly contains letters on the implementation of the General Treaty of 1820 including a system of watch and cruise and what actions to take in case of suspected piracy. It also includes a letter from H R Durham, Assistant Political Agent, Qishm Island, to James Dow, Assistant Resident at Bushire forwarding the translation of a letter from 'the Prince of Shiraz' complaining about the occupation of Qishm island by the British. Another letter from the Accountant General, Bombay Castle to Captain William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, requests greater regularity in the transmission of accounts.
